turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Mine.

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Have you always had it?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Have you looked inside?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: What's inside?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Humans.

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: That's who you are too, Emma.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Before... when I was one of them. I would look at this and it was just strangers.  Now I... remember.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You want me to stay?

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Do you still want me to stay?

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Emma...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: He wanted me to see -- he thinks I was -- infected by you.

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Shhh... don't talk.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I want to talk.  I just learned again.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You have to go.  He'll never stop. Leave this place.  Find another.

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: I'll go.  We'll both go.  Far away.

turns.speaker: FRENCH VOICE
turns.text: Good evening.  Did you have a pleasant day today?

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Busy.  I went swimming and prepared a new vehicle.  A big vehicle.

turns.speaker: FRENCH VOICE
turns.text: That sounds charming.  Did you meet any interesting people today?

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Yesterday.  They're back.  Haven't seen them for a few months.  I have to be careful.

turns.speaker: FRENCH VOICE
turns.text: Tell me about the interesting people you met, won't you?

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: They are... sinister.  They want to kill me.

turns.speaker: FRENCH VOICE
turns.text: That sounds charming.  What are you planning to do tomorrow?

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Stay alive.

turns.speaker: VIRGINIA
turns.text: I remember the first time we met. Do you remember that?

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: VIRGINIA
turns.text: It was at Diane's party in Malibu and I had just broken up with Todd and I was loaded for bear, any man who had the nerve to come at me -- watch out.  So you come sauntering in -- you know that saunter you do. That watch out, baby, here comes Mr. Smooth thing.

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: You and that damned garden.

turns.speaker: VIRGINIA
turns.text: Yeah, but when your mother came what's the first thing you showed her?

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: I surrender --

turns.speaker: VIRGINIA
turns.text: Besides, if we get a lot of work done this summer it'll be done.

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: It's never gonna be done.  You love puttering out there too much.

turns.speaker: VIRGINIA
turns.text: Well, it's not supposed to be done anyway.

turns.speaker: VIRGINIA
turns.text: The more we plant, the more that'll grow, and the happier --

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Virginia...?

turns.speaker: VIRGINIA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Need some gas?

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Only got one kind.

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: That's fine.

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Hell of a night.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: You got that right.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: So, what do you do?

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: I'm am architect.  I'm working on a site back in --

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: You built things.

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: I guess you could say that.

turns.speaker: NEVILLE
turns.text: Bathroom?

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Round back.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Son ... are you awake?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: We're going to be moving, son.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Do we have to?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I know, son.  But you'll like it where we're going.  I'm getting a good job.  It's a pretty part of the country.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I'll have to go to a new school -- again.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: You'll meet new friends.  I know ... it's rough.  But I have to move, son.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What's that, Dad?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: That's the Air Force Base.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Wow.  Look at the mountains.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: This can be your room if you want it. What do you say?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Is the hill ours too?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: If we want it, it is.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Let's check it out, Dad.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Wow.  There's the town.  And there's the air base.  This is a great hill.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: It's got a name.  Copper Ridge. There used to be a copper mine near here.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Let's see what's on the other side. Maybe we'll find some copper.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: A meteorite, Dad, look!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: It's that time of year again. We should get a pretty good show out here.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Why, Dad?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Because the sky is so clear out here.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: There are more this year than last.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: This should be the heaviest shower of the year.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: There's Cassius ...

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: ... and Rigel.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: And that one -- to the right of Rigel?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Which one's that?  The dull, red one.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: That's Mars.  The closest planet to us, now.  That's why it's more than just a point in the sky.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Well, son?  Should we call it a night?  I for one have had a long day.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Jim -- what's wrong?!

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You've got to come see -- a big thing went down over the hill!

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It was big -- and it glowed -- and it went down over there -- behind the hill.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: What did it look like?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It was -- it was -- it changed shape. First it was big and round, then it was flat, then it was long and thin.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Are you sure you saw that?  In the rain -- it may have <u>looked</u> like it changed shape --

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I don't know, Dad.  But it was big.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I'll go take a look when the rain lets off.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Are you all right, Dad?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Sure ... fine.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I lost it.  It's kind of muddy out there.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Was there anything over the hill?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I had an awful dream.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: What, Jim, what?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: First lemme look at your necks.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: ... And then everything blew up. And then I woke up.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: That's a doozy of a dream, son.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It was so real, Dad.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: It was all made of stuff that's happened to you in the last few days.  The sand pit in back of the house, and the meteor shower, and meeting your teacher and the colonel at school, and being afraid of the new kids because you don't know them ...

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I know, Ellen.  We'll settle down soon.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I was so scared.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Better now, son?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: I have to go over to the town this morning and do a lot of shopping. This house needs just <u>everything</u>. I'll probably be gone all day. Jimmy, hurry up and eat or you'll be late.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I'll take you to school.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: You don't have to.  The school bus stops right outside here, at 7:30. I've got to run.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: It's probably the solenoid.  Take it back to Gleason's, they said they'd fix it if we found anything wrong.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: I will.  But isn't that odd -- about my dream ... ?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: What happened to you?  Who was that?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: That's Ed.  Ed works with the Bell Telephone switching division.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Where's your car?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I left it at work.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: You did?  Why? Where were you? They said you left hours ago. We were worried.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I'm home now.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Yes -- but ...

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: You know, it really is beautiful up there.  Let me show you.  We'll take a walk after dinner.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: George, you're acting very strangely.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: What's wrong, Ellen?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: It's his nightmare.  He still hasn't gotten over it ... about the other side of the hill.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Better get some sleep, son, or you'll be pretty tired at school tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Good night.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: We'll be by to pick him up in ten minutes.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Yes, Mr. Gardner.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: What do you mean -- gone?  What the hell kind of a nurse are you, anyway?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Gardner.  I was out of my office for a minute and when I got back -- he was gone.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: What did he talk to you about?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: He was upset with moving, I believe.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Is that all he said?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Why, yes.  Why?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Hello, this is Ms. Magnuson speaking.

turns.speaker: DAD'S VOICE
turns.text: I understand, Miss, that you have my son in your office.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Yes, I do, Mr. Gardner.

turns.speaker: DAD'S VOICE
turns.text: May I ask why?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: We were having a little talk.

turns.speaker: DAD'S VOICE
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Children often have trouble adjusting to a new school.

turns.speaker: DAD'S VOICE
turns.text: I don't know what he's told you --  What <u>has</u> he told you?  Would you like to tell <u>me</u> -- ?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Mr. Gardner, I --

turns.speaker: DAD'S VOICE
turns.text: You people have a lot of nerve, taking it on yourselves to encourage young children to speak out of turn. I'm of a mind to pull him out of school if this is your idea of how to handle ... What sort of training do you have anyway?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Mr. Gardner, I don't think this is the place to discuss this matter.

turns.speaker: DAD'S VOICE
turns.text: I'm not particularly interested, <u>Ms.</u> Magnuson, in what you think is correct. My wife and I are going away on a business trip this afternoon and we want Jimmy with us.  Keep him in your office until we arrive.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: This is a new town for you.  Do you like it here?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Why not?  Moving is hard for anybody.  Was it hard for you to leave all your friends?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I don't have many friends.  Dad's all the time moving.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Can you tell me about that?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: That's quite a story.  You know that, don't you?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: A UFO lands in back of your house and puts something in your Dad and Mom's necks.  Then it gets the police, and your teacher too.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: How did it get Mrs. McKeltch?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: She said the frog came from around the Copper Ridge.  She must've been behind the hill.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: What would you think if somebody told you a story like this?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I'd believe him.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: 'Cause he wouldn't lie.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Do you know how to follow a map?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yes.  I can even read star maps.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: This shows how to get to my home. I'm giving you back roads and footpaths, so there's less chance of you being seen.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Jimmy, calm down!  What happened? Tell me what happened!

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I got trapped in Mrs. McKeltch's van -- and she went to the tunnel and went down there with them -- behind my house.  I saw them.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Where, Jimmy?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Behind my house, up on the ridge.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: If we go and look and there's nothing there, you'll have to admit to me that this is all in your mind.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: This is where it was -- the tunnel opening.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I don't see anything.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: No, but it was here.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I swear it was here.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: But it's not, Jimmy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Let's go look at the sand pit behind your house.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: They'll get us.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: We'll be very careful.  But we have to see.  If something landed there, there would be a big scar in the ground. Wouldn't there?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Does it look to you like anything landed here?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Maybe -- it landed in the bushes.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Stay here.  I'm going to make a phone call.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Who are you calling?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: The State Police.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Did you call the State Police?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: All their lines were busy.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: No one comes here after dark.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Hide the car.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Damn.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I know a way.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: I don't know.  I don't know what I'm doing here --

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: But you saw -- the men go under the sand ...

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Yes ... yes, but I'm not sure what I saw anymore.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Don't go in.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I'm not.  They must be tunneling under the whole town.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: We can't do this alone.  We've got to get help.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: There was a man named Colonel Wilson, from the Air Force Base.  He was talking in our class.  He said we could visit him any time we wanted.  I'll bet he could do something.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Let's try.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: You're looking for life?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: They didn't find any signs of life on the Viking missions.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Well, come on, you two.  Time to go to bed.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Mom -- this is the best show all year.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: I know.  But you have a full day of school tomorrow --  You, too.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: What do you think he saw?  Could it have been something from the air base?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: No, Mom.  It wasn't a plane.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: George, where have you been?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What happened to your other slipper?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Your father asked you a question.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What? -- I...

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Hi.  Sorry I'm late.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: The back door was open.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Mom.  I gotta talk to you.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Don't go over the hill, Mom. Please.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: This afternoon.  It's wonderful up there -- you still haven't seen the best part.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I have school.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: I'll pack us a lunch.  Hamburgers. You always like that, don't you.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: It's all this moving from place to place.  We're never settled.  I'm having nightmares myself.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What kind, Mom?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Oh, I can't remember.  But people do have bad dreams when their routine is disturbed.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: What's the story on Jimmy Gardner?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL
turns.text: Gardner?  Oh, um -- he's a new student. Just moved here.  Why?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: His teacher brought him in to see me. Said he'd been acting up in class. Creating a disturbance.  I couldn't get a thing out of him.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL
turns.text: Oh?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: What's his family background?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL
turns.text: They're from out of state.  Father's an engineer at the nuclear power plant. I really don't know much about them.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL
turns.text: Ms. Magnuson, is Jimmy Gardner with you?

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Why, yes.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL
turns.text: Jimmy's father is on the phone.  I wonder if you'd take the call.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: All right.  I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Penicillin. At least it will help keep his fever down.

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: It's really nice of you to help us.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: I wish I could do more but we're moving out.

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: We're going with you. I mean, we're going too.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: This could be our last night on Earth. I don't want to die a virgin.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: If we do, we'll both die virgins. But at last we'll be together.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You have to leave the White House.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: This is not the time or the place to have this same old discussion.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You don't understand. You have to leave Washington.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: In case you haven't noticed, we're in a little bit of a crisis here.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I've worked with embedded loading. They're communicating with a hidden signal. They're going to attack...

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: You're being paranoid.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's not paranoia. The embedding is very subtle. It's probably been overlooked...

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Connie, don't hang up.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: David? How'd you get this number?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Walk to the window. Right in front of you.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: And when is the countdown supposed to expire?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Fifty six minutes, forty five seconds.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I want you to leave with us. Right now.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: I can't leave. We have to tell this to the President.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: He's not going to listen to me.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You can't be seriously considering firing nuclear weapons?

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: David, don't...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Just my luck, no ice.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: I take it you've heard.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: A toast to the end of the world.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You still believe in him.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: He's a good man.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Better be. You left me for him.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: I wanted a career. Didn't you ever want to be part of something special?

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: Thirty seconds? Isn't that cutting it a little too close?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We'll be well on our way out of there before we shoot that thing off.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: With you? I don't understand why you can't just show someone how to plant the virus, somebody trained for this kind of mission?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: If anything goes wrong I'll have to think quickly, adjust the signal, who knows?

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Did it work?

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: You bet it did.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: David thought I was having an affair, which I wasn't.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: Punched the President? Oh my god.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: Moishe Martinsburg, Mr. President.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: My ex-husband works in satellite communications.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: He still gets air sick, huh? In all of this I didn't get the chance to thank you two.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: Think nothing of it, Spanky.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: Spunky. He told you about that?

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: All he could think about was getting to you. There's still love there I think.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: Love was never our problem.

turns.speaker: MOISHE
turns.text: All you need is love. John Lennon. Smart man. Shot in the back, very sad.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Can we expect the same kid of panic here as in Russia?

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: More than likely.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: I don't know how you put up with him.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: He used to run the NASA. He knows where all the bones are buried. Comes in handy.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: I'll bet.

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: You saved a lot of lives.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: I could have evacuated the cities hours ago.  You know, when I flew in the Gulf War everything is simple. We knew what we had to do. It's not simple anymore, Connie. A lot of people died today. How many didn't have to?

turns.speaker: CONSTANCE
turns.text: We're losing them.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Then get them out of there.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: What the hell is the point of having a beeper if you don't turn it on?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It was turned on. I was ignoring you. What's the big emergency?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Started this morning. Every channel is making like it's nineteen fifty. Snow, static, all kinds of distortions. No one knows what the hell is going on.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What the hell is this?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: So sue me.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Did you try to switch to transponder channels?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Please, would I be this panicked if it was that simple?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Let's retrofit the dish to another satellite.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: We've tried. It's not working. It's almost as though they weren't even there.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: There's good news and bad news.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: What's the bad news?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You're in meal penalty for disturbing my lunch.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: And the good news is you won't charge me.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No. The good news is I found the problem and it's not our equipment. There's some weird signal embedded within the satellite feed.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: That's the good news?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes, because the analog signal has a definite sequential digital patterns embedded within it. When I find the exact binary sequence and I apply a phase reversed signal to that calculated spectra analyzer I built you last Christmas, we should be able to block out the overlay completely...

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: ...and we'll be the only guys in town with a clear picture? That's my man.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I've got a lock on the signal pattern. We can filter it out.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Huh? Oh, good, good.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Strange thing is, if my calculations are right it'll be gone in approximately seven hours anyway. The signal reduces itself every time it recycles. Eventually it will disappear. Are you listening?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Can you believe this?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What're you talking about?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Haven't you been watching?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Tell her to get the kids and leave town.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Just do it!

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Okay, why did I just send my family to Atlanta?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Remember I told you that the signal hidden within our satellite signal is slowly recycling down to extinction.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Not really...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: That signal. It's a countdown.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: A countdown to what?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Think. It's like in chess. First you strategically position your pieces. Then, when the timing's right. You strike.
